election_record.label: New York 1802 U.S. Senate, Special

overview.note: The open Senate seat was "in the place of John Armstrong, resigned." The Poughkeepsie Journal (Poughkeepsie, NY). February 16, 1802.

The Assembly nominated DeWitt Clinton to fill the Senate vacancy over Matthew Clarkson by a vote of 68 to 25. The Senate nominated Matthew Clarkson over DeWitt Clinton by a vote of 19 to 16. Thus, "not agreeing on their choice, they then proceeded to a joint ballot. On counting the ballots Mr. Clinton had 82, and Mr. Clarkson 45-" The Poughkeepsie Journal (Poughkeepsie, NY). February 16, 1802

sub_unit.name: Assembly
sub_unit.note: Both the Poughkeepsie Journal February 16, 1802 and the Hudson Gazette (Hudson, NY) February 12, 1802, list 28 votes for Matthew Clarkson in the Assembly.

sub_unit.name: Senate
sub_unit.note: The Connecticut Gazette, and the Commercial Intelligencer (New London, CT), February 24, 1802, lists 18 votes for Matthew Clarkson in the Senate.
